sentences.en: Do your ankles swell at night?
sentences.cn: 你夜里脚踝肿吗？

sentences.en: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
sentences.cn: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。

sentences.en: Her arm was beginning to swell up where the bee had stung her.
sentences.cn: 她胳膊给蜜蜂蜇了，肿了起来。

sentences.en: Hills swell gradually from the plain.
sentences.cn: 山渐渐从平原隆起.

sentences.en: His face began to swell out.
sentences.cn: 他的脸膀起来了.

sentences.en: His injured wrist began to swell.
sentences.cn: 他那受伤的手腕开始肿了.

sentences.en: I am not saying this to make your head swell.
sentences.cn: 我这样说不是为了让你感到自以为是的。

sentences.en: I've had a swell time.
sentences.cn: 我过得极为开心。

sentences.en: if I say this, you'll get swollen-headed.
sentences.cn: 要是我这么说，你肯定会觉得自己了不起的。

sentences.en: Its body plumage suddenly began to ruffle and swell.
sentences.cn: 它全身的羽毛突然竖了起来，胀得鼓鼓的。

sentences.en: She could see her two sons swell with pride.
sentences.cn: 她能看出她的两个儿子充满了骄傲。

sentences.en: The boat rocked in the swell.
sentences.cn: 船在海浪中摇摆.

sentences.en: The crowd swelled to around 10,000.
sentences.cn: 人群增加到一万人左右。

sentences.en: The industry reckons it will see orders swell by 10% this financial year. Some hope.
sentences.cn: 业界估计本财年订单会增加10%。这绝对不可能。

sentences.en: The river was swollen with melted snow.
sentences.cn: 积雪融化，河水上涨。

sentences.en: The road ride swell.
sentences.cn: 这条路行车[骑马]很舒服.

sentences.en: The waves had taken on a deep swell.
sentences.cn: 海浪汹涌.

sentences.en: The wind swelled the sails.
sentences.cn: 风鼓起了船帆。

sentences.en: The window frame was swollen shut.
sentences.cn: 窗框膨胀变形，关得死死的。

sentences.en: There are people who swell with pride whenever they make some small contribution.
sentences.cn: 有些人出了一点力就觉得了不起.

sentences.en: These small items help to swell the total.
sentences.cn: 这些小项目使总额增加了.

sentences.en: We bobbed gently up and down on the swell of the incoming tide.
sentences.cn: 我们随着涨潮的浪涌轻轻地起伏。

words.tran_cn: 膨胀；隆起；增大（swell的过去分词）
肿胀；膨胀；增多；趾高气扬（swell的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 极好的，了不起的，非常棒的

trans.tran_en: the roundness or curved shape of something

trans.tran_cn: 膨胀，肿胀，增加，增强，充满（激情）
trans.tran_en: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body

trans.tran_cn: 膨胀，隆起；增长，增强，增多，扩大
trans.tran_en: to increase in amount or number

trans.tran_cn: 使膨胀；使增强，使壮大，使隆起
trans.tran_en: to curve or make something curve
